title: Fresh milk trade turning into mafia: National Consumer Front
byline: The sale of fresh milk in Sri Lanka has turned into a ’mafia’, with dairy companies allegedly exploiting consumers, National Consumer Front leader Asela Sampath charged on Tuesday.

title: Maryland Sri Lankans donate Rs. 5.2 m for Cyclone Ditwah relief
byline: The Sri Lankan community in Maryland, United States, has donated a further Rs. 5.2 million to the Government’s Rebuild Sri Lanka Fund, supporting efforts to restore the lives of people affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: President Xi says India, China ‘friends, partners’ in republic day message
byline: Chinese President Xi Jinping has said Beijing and New Delhi are “good neighbours, friends and partners” as the two Asian giants continue to improve ties in the wake of United States President Donald Trump’s tariff war, which has shaken global trade.

title: Shiranthi Rajapaksa seeks two-week grace period from FCID
byline: Shiranthi Rajapaksa, the wife of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, has informed her legal team that she will be unable to appear before the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) today (27) due to personal reasons.

title: Education Secretary seeks principal’s report
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Nalaka Kaluwewa, has instructed the principal of a popular school in Colombo to submit a report regarding an alleged close relationship between the school’s head prefect and three female teachers, and the circulation of related videos on social media.

title: Trump raises US tariffs on South Korea imports to 25%
byline: US President Donald Trump has announced he is raising tariffs on South Korean imports to 25% after accusing Seoul of ’’not living up’’ to a trade deal reached last year.

title: Frequent influx of purported UFO footage: Professor Jayaratne
byline: Professor Chandana Jayaratne, head of the Department of Physics at the University of Colombo and Chairman of the Arthur C. Clarke Institute for Modern Technologies, has stated that videos purporting to show Unidentified Flying Objects (UFOs) are regularly submitted to him and associated scientific institutions in Sri Lanka.

title: Substandard coal causing Rs.75Mn loss daily?
byline: The Electricity Consumers’ Association (ECA) has urged the government to make public the survey reports obtained from India and the Lakvijaya Coal Power Plant in Norochcholai, claiming that the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) is incurring a daily loss of Rs. 75 million due to substandard coal used for power generation.

title: ’Major step’: French MPs vote in favour of bill to ban social media for under-15s
byline: France’s National Assembly has backed a bill that would ban social media access for under-15s, a proposal supported by President Emmanuel Macron.

title: Airports reintroduce COVID-style checks after virus outbreak in India
byline: Airports across parts of Asia have begun tightening health surveillance and travel screening after an outbreak of Nipah virus in an Indian state.

title: Adani-JKH West Terminal outpaces state-run ECT in 2025 race
byline: A tale of contrasting velocities has emerged in the Port of Colombo, with the private sector-led Colombo West International Terminal (CWIT) rapidly outpacing the state-managed East Container Terminal (ECT) in 2025, prompting renewed calls from industry heavyweights to open the latter for private investment.

title: Sri Lanka exports top US $ 17.2bn in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s export earnings surpassed US $ 17.2 billion in 2025, extending the recovery in external trade as merchandise and services exports posted broad-based gains, according to the data compiled by Sri Lanka Customs and the Export Development Board (EDB).

title: Mass tourism alone won’t boost Sri Lanka’s economy: Ex-UNEP Chief
byline: Former United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) Executive Director Eric Solheim asserted that Sri Lanka must look beyond visitor numbers and focus on pricing its unique environmental assets higher to drive economic growth.

title: Injured elephant roams Mahaoya villages, devastates crops
byline: A wounded wild elephant has been roaming about in Samagipura, Pulawala, and Bendirekka areas in Mahaoya division for several days.

title: Doctors hold patients hostage as strike enters second day
byline: Patients across the country continued to face disruption as doctors pressed ahead with their trade union action for a second consecutive day following the launch of an island-wide strike by the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) from 8.00 a.m. yesterday.

title: India and EU set to announce landmark trade deal
byline: The European Union and India are set to announce a landmark trade deal after nearly two decades of on-off talks, as both sides aim to deepen ties amid tensions with the US.

title: Nipah virus found in Colombo from 2018-2019; it could be around even now: Health expert
byline: Nipah virus has been found in Sri Lankan fruits bats in samples collected from Colombo from 2018-2019 and that it could be around even now, Prof. Neelika Malavige said.

title: Six Gampaha police officers interdicted over alleged assault on priest
byline: Six police officers attached to the Gampaha Police Divisional Crime Detective Bureau (DCDB), who were arrested and remanded for allegedly assaulting a Catholic priest, have been interdicted.

title: Mandatory seat belt rule comes into full effect
byline: The National Council for Road Safety said that police have begun imposing fines for seat belt violations across the country, following the conclusion of a three-month transition period.

title: Activist interrupts Minister during Colombo Fort inspection
byline: Transport, Highways and Urban Development Minister Bimal Rathnayaka was interrupted yesterday by a civil activist during an inspection visit to the Colombo Fort Railway Station to review a proposed flyover linking the Pettah bus stand.

title: Sri Lanka on alert on Nipah virus cases in India
byline: Sri Lankan health authorities are closely monitoring developments following the detection of a cluster of Nipah virus infections in India’s eastern state of West Bengal, amid heightened surveillance measures across parts of Asia.

title: Police serve Namal summons at 9.50 am for 9.30 am court appearance: SLPP
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) General Secretary Sagara Kariyawasam has strongly criticised the police for issuing a summons to MP Namal Rajapaksa that was impossible to comply with, citing serious procedural lapses and alleged political motivation.

title: Radiology technologists to launch islandwide strike from tomorrow
byline: The Government Radiology Technologists Association (GRTA) has decided to launch a continuous islandwide strike from 8.00 a.m. tomorrow (28), its Chairman Chanaka Dharmawickrama said.

title: Criminal behaviour among youth aged 16–22 on the rise in Sri Lanka
byline: Criminal behaviour among young people aged between 16 and 22 has increased significantly over the past 10 years in Sri Lanka, Forensic Psychiatrist Dr Tharaka Fernando said.

title: China cancels all flights on 49 routes to Japan
byline: All scheduled flights on 49 air routes between China and Japan have been cancelled for February, flight data showed on Jan 26, as Chinese airlines extended special ticket change and refund policies for Japan-related travel.

title: Select Committee to probe 323 containers, conclude in three months
byline: The Parliamentary Select Committee appointed to inquire into the release of 323 containers from the Port of Colombo without mandatory physical inspection has decided to meet weekly and aims to complete its investigation within three months.

title: Three French tourists drown after their boat capsizes in Oman
byline: At least three French tourists have drowned in Oman after the boat they were in capsized in waters off the sultanate’s capital city of Muscat, police said.

title: WHO to supply childhood cancer medicines to Sri Lanka for 3 years
byline: The World Health Organization (WHO) will soon sign an agreement with Sri Lankan health authorities to provide essential medicines for childhood cancer patients over the next three years.

title: Sri Lanka Eye Donation Society marks 65 years, donates over 100,000 corneas
byline: The Sri Lanka Eye Donation Society has celebrated 65 years of service, having donated more than 100,000 corneas for transplantation abroad over the decades.

title: Authorities refuse Opposition MPs’ entry to Lakvijeya Power Plant
byline: The authorities of Lakvijeya Power Plant showed reluctance to allow the Opposition MPs to enter the plant together with journalists but showed some kind of flexibility after they explained the situation.

title: Former Chairman of Lanka Coal Limited summoned before Parliamentary Committee over coal deal
byline: The Sectoral Oversight Committee on Infrastructure and Strategic Development has decided to summon the former Chairman of Lanka Coal (Private) Limited, who was involved in the processes related to the import of the controvercial coal consignments, before the committee.

title: Tense situation outside Presidential Secretariat over hunger strike
byline: A tense situation was reported outside the Presidential Secretariat today as police moved to halt the continuous hunger strike launched by the Association of School Development Officers.

title: Dilki Watsala Marambage appointed Director General of Technical Education and Training
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the appointment of Ms. Dilki Watsala Marambage as the Director General of the Department of Technical Education and Training, a post that has been vacant.

title: Government extends validity of driving licenses due to November disruptions
byline: The validity of driving licenses set to expire between November 25, 2025, and December 24, 2025, has been extended by one month from their original expiry date.

title: Bradman cap fetches record price at auction
byline: A baggy green cap worn by Donald Bradman fetched A$460,000 (US$319,000) at public auction in Australia on Monday, a record price for a cap worn by the Australian cricket legend.

title: Sri Lanka announce six-game tour of the West Indies
byline: Sri Lanka have announced a six-match tour of the West Indies with matches played across February and March 2026.

title: India and EU set to announce landmark trade deal
byline: The European Union and India are set to announce a landmark trade deal after nearly two decades of on-off talks, as both sides aim to deepen ties amid tensions with the US.

title: Body of RDA employee missing in landslide recovered after two months
byline: The body of a 30-year-old man who went missing following a landslide in Gawarammana village, Welimada, was recovered on Monday (26th), more than two months after the incident.

title: President criticises opposition over shifting stance on education reforms
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today accused the Opposition of changing its position on the government’s education reforms saying attempts to create confusion would not derail the administration’s reform agenda.

title: UDA to develop ‘Frolic Island’ recreational hub along Diyawanna Oya
byline: The Urban Development Authority (UDA) is set to launch the “Frolic Island Recreational Hub” project along both banks of the Diyawanna Oya, aimed at creating a major public leisure and recreation zone in the Battaramulla area.

title: Plan afoot to restore Kalu River mouth and Calido beach
byline: The Cabinet approval has been granted to move ahead with plans to restore the Calido beach, the Kalutara lagoon and the mouth of the Kalu River following severe coastal erosion triggered by flood mitigation measures implemented in 2017.

title: Myanmar steps up Nipah virus monitoring, issues travel health advisory
byline: Myanmar’s Ministry of Health has strengthened monitoring measures for the Nipah virus and issued health advice for travelers, despite no confirmed cases being detected in the country to date, according to the ministry’s statement released on Tuesday.

title: Dry weather to prevail across most parts of the country
byline: The Department of Meteorology says dry weather conditions are expected to prevail across most parts of the country.
